title: The Strange Decline of America’s Global Power
description: The problem isn’t weakness at the top. It’s the enemy within.

title: Piling Horror Upon Horror
description: Grief over Israel doesn’t mean we can look away from mass death in Gaza.

title: Oprah Floated a 2020 Presidential Run With Mitt Romney, Book Says
description: Ms. Winfrey wanted to form the independent ticket to stop Donald J. Trump, according to a forthcoming book. Mr. Romney listened to the pitch but passed on the idea, the biography says.

title: Biden Weighs Visiting Israel
description: Also, we preview Teju Cole’s new book. Here’s the latest at the end of Monday.

title: F.D.A. Plans to Ban Hair Straighteners With Formaldehyde
description: The products, often marketed to Black women, have been linked to an increased risk of uterine cancer.

title: How Jim Jordan, a Fighter Aligned With Trump, Fought His Way to Power
description: The Ohio Republican defines himself by his penchant for punching back, whether against allegations that he was derelict in a sex abuse scandal or attempts to prosecute the former president.

title: Jordan Inches Closer to Speakership, but Republican Holdouts Remain
description: The Ohio Republican won over several mainstream members of his party who had initially withheld their support, but was still short of the votes needed to win the gavel.

title: More Than 400,000 Student Loan Borrowers Have Wrong Monthly Payments
description: The Education Department said miscalculations had caused many borrowers to see higher monthly payments than they actually owed.

title: Biden Weighs the Risks of a Wartime Visit to Israel
description: A presidential trip to Israel at such a critical moment would pose enormous challenges for the White House, in terms of both politics and security.

title: At Egypt-Gaza Border, Confusion and Frustration Reign
description: Told they could escape Gaza, scores of people with foreign passports gathered at the only border crossing into Egypt, only to find it still closed, as diplomatic efforts floundered.

title: Yellen Assures Europe That U.S. Will Provide More Funds for Ukraine
description: The Treasury secretary reassured allies that the Biden administration was not backing away from Ukraine despite opposition in Congress.

title: Yellowstone Border Purchase Stops Gold Mine From Infringing on Bear Habitat
description: A conservation group acquired more than 1,500 acres just north of Yellowstone National Park to stop a gold mine that they say would have upset the habitat of bears and other wildlife.

title: Menendez Held a Tropical Fund-Raiser. Donors Were Scarce. So Was He.
description: An event in Puerto Rico to benefit Senator Robert Menendez’s political action committee suffered numerous cancellations after the senator’s indictment.

title: Suzanne Somers, Original Influencer?
description: Long before influencers took over, the actress went from sitcom fame to cheerleader for supplements, exercise fads and sexual wellness, with great success.

title: Why a Gaza Invasion and ‘Once and for All’ Thinking Are Wrong for Israel
description: The Netanyahu government and President Biden have smarter options.

title: The Salmon on Your Plate Has a Troubling Cost. These Farms Offer Hope.
description: Land-based aquaculture is still coming into its own, but it stands to upend an industry plagued by environmental concerns.

title: Migrant Families Separated at U.S. Border by Trump Reach Settlement
description: Thousands of migrants subjected to the policy will be allowed to live and work in the U.S., at least temporarily. If they win asylum, they could become citizens.

title: Circa Central Park Is Notorious for Bird Collisions. Residents Want Change.
description: A shiny glass condo property in the city has become notorious for deadly crashes, so some residents are pushing for change.

title: Harvard Cozies Up to #MentalHealth TikTok
description: As young Americans turn to TikTok for information on mental health, the T.H. Chan School of Public Health at Harvard is building its own team of influencers.

title: Funeral Planned for Illinois Boy Killed in Suspected Anti-Muslim Hate Crime
description: The family of Wadea Al-Fayoume, 6, was set to mourn him at a funeral in suburban Chicago. The man accused in the boy’s death was scheduled to appear in court.

title: Scientists Offer a New Explanation for Long Covid
description: In some patients, remnants of the coronavirus in the gut may stifle production of serotonin, an important neurotransmitter, researchers suggest.

title: As the Strike Wears On, Actors Return to Restaurants
description: The Hollywood cliché of performers working as servers in restaurants is back.

title: China Bet It All on Real Estate. Now Its Economy Is Paying the Price.
description: After relying on a borrow-to-build model for decades, Beijing must make difficult choices about the country’s housing market and economic future.

title: Here’s the latest on the hearing.
description: Defense lawyers and prosecutors will square off over whether the former president should be restricted in what he can say about the proceedings after a string of threatening statements.

title: Families of Hamas Hostages Share Their Anguish
description: Relatives of those captured or missing express despair at the lack of information, and they are terrified of what an expected Israeli invasion of Gaza may mean for their loved ones.

title: 4 Ukrainian Children Return From Russia After Intervention by Qatar
description: Kyiv has said that thousands of children have been separated from their families and taken to Russia, in one of the most painful issues for Ukraine since the start of the war.

title: Lab Leak Fight Casts Chill Over Virology Research
description: Scientists doing “gain-of-function” research said that heightened fears of lab leaks are stalling studies that could thwart the next pandemic virus.

title: A Shift in Gerrymandering
description: The end of a Republican advantage.

title: Voices From Gaza
description: As hundreds of thousands flee south from northern Gaza, we hear from two people caught in the chaos.

title: Hundreds of Thousands Flee Northern Gaza, and More
description: Plus, diplomats try to ease the growing humanitarian crisis in the enclave, and a look at Donald Trump’s back-room campaign.

title: There’s Still No House Speaker. What Happens Now?
description: The House is entering its second week without a speaker. Here is how a new one could be elected, or how the process could go off the rails yet again.

title: I Saw What Happened to America’s Postwar Plans for Iraq. Here’s How Israel Should Plan for Gaza.
description: After the lessons the United States should have learned from postwar Iraq, some advice for Israel and its plans for a post-Hamas Gaza.

title: Lawsuits Challenge Voting Rights Left to Governor Discretion in Some States
description: Three states let governors use their discretion to deny voting rights to former prisoners. Lawsuits in two of them say that violates the First Amendment.

title: Biden Will Get $80 Million Ad Boost From Climate Group
description: Climate Power says the lack of awareness and understanding of the president’s record on environmental issues is hurting him in the polls.

title: Judge to Consider Gag Order on Trump in Federal Election Case
description: Defense lawyers and prosecutors will square off over whether the former president should be restricted in what he can say about the proceedings after a string of threatening statements.

title: The Plot Trump Lost
description: What I heard when I listened to Trump for more than 30 seconds.

title: The Best Restaurants in New Orleans
description: There’s plenty of great Creole and Cajun food, of course, but also outstanding Vietnamese, Indian and Trinbagonian cuisine.

title: The Return-to-Office Movement Is Dead
description: Remote work is not going anywhere.

title: Annie Leibovitz, Now an Empty-Nester, Lists Upper West Side Duplex
description: The celebrated photographer is selling her co-op at 88 Central Park West. She is asking $8.6 million, and paid almost $11.3 million nine years ago.

title: Lab Leak Fight Casts Chill Over Virology Research
description: Scientists doing “gain-of-function” research said that heightened fears of lab leaks are stalling studies that could thwart the next pandemic virus.

title: How Fred Daibes, a Real Estate Tycoon, Was Implicated in the Menendez Case
description: Fred Daibes, a New Jersey builder, was accused of defrauding a bank that he had founded. Prosecutors say he turned to Senator Robert Menendez for help.

title: To Avoid War, the U.S. Must Both Deter and Reassure China
description: To ensure peace, America must recommit to a time-tested policy of neutrality on Taiwan.

title: How Nepal’s Deal With China for an Airport Became an Albatross
description: China called the project a “signature” of its cooperation with Nepal. Insiders and documents reveal the pitfalls of China’s infrastructure-at-any-cost model.

title: Trump’s Giant Lead Is Financial, Too: 6 Takeaways From 2024 Filings
description: Ron DeSantis has spent heavily and Nikki Haley has padded her war chest. On the Democratic side, President Biden continues to show overall strength, and the party’s incumbent senators fared well.

title: Rite Aid, Facing Slumping Sales and Opioid Suits, Files for Bankruptcy
description: The pharmacy chain, one of the country’s largest, faces more than a thousand lawsuits that say it filled illegal prescriptions for painkillers.
